reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought the spa package which involved a spa room, nice patio, bottle of wine and delicious breakfast.
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend, awesome room

reviews.text: Very very happy - best accommodation in Maitland having stayed in a few places would definitely go back!
reviews.title: Comfortable,Clean, Great Value for Money

reviews.text: We booked last minute.com Queen Deluxe Room for $110.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Staying for one night after a wedding function also at the Bradford. This is newly built so as expected room was modern,quite spacious & very clean.
reviews.title: Modern, clean and comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed one night on trip to Canberra. near new so was nice & fresh. room was of good size with with good bedding. plenty of space in bathroom. small back area that was open to all units so no private outside sitting area. could be a bit of a worry if you were next a family with nosey children. breakfast was OK but no restaurant. pub at the end of parking handy for a meal & a refreshing ale.
reviews.title: bright & clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a nice place to stay for a few nights; it's in a good location not too far from the Hunter Valley. I was also confused as to whether it was a hotel or motel but the rooms were nice and everything was quiet and great value for money. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Clean, affordable and in a good location.

reviews.text: When I booked this I thought I was booking a hotel, when I arrived it was a lot more like a motel. The rooms are all ground floor single units with plenty of parking, but once in the room it could easily be a hotel room. It was clean and comfortable with a large bathroom, fridge and minibar. Only snag being that you have to go outside for anything, not that there was much provided. It was raining, so I didn't check out the pool, breakfast was $15 extra in a separate building, that was about it, not really a hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel or motel??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a handy garage, and two fast food chains across the road, but if that's not your thing be prepared for a drive to the nearest town. There is a pub serving food next door, but when I went it was fully booked one night, and had sold out of the specials the next night, so I ended up with an expensive but tasteless meal. Overall, I had no real complaints, but it wasn't cheap and I'm not sure what I was paying for.
reviews.title: Ticks the boxes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needed a relatively cheap place to stay in Rutherford and although it is a motel, it is clean, modern and had a sense of character.
reviews.title: Mecure Maitland (Rutherford/ Aberglasslyn)

reviews.text: New motel which seems rare in the NSW country these days. This makes it feel perfectly clean and just the ticket for a business stay. Rooms not huge, so maybe not the place for a 1 week holiday, yet suits a short stay.
reviews.title: modern, clean, quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TV's are LCD, however could be bigger. High speed internet was great, this makes a motel for me. Food in the restaurant was superb, and they do a "proper" coffee. hard to find good goffee in Maitland
reviews.title: OK, but charged over $220 for Saturday night and could hear the neighbours talking

reviews.text: The room was average and the photo from the previous reviewer was identical. Service was good when we arrived, but on departure on Sunday, 22 March, when we let them know we could the neighbour in the next room, speaking not yelling mind you, at her children. The receptionist replied "I don't know what they are going to do about that now". It all seemed a little too hard, I was just letting them know? Location is 35 minutes from the vineyards, but close to fast food joints and has a pub on location. It's very new, lots of ample parking but the air conditioners don't really keep the room cool enough. It get real hot there. The bathroom and room was clean, but really only had a problem with hearing the neighbours get up before 10 on a Sunday. I really like to sleep in. Would really only recommend it as a last resort. Staff in the bar were friendly and more than efficient.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Bradford

likes.disliked: — Reception staff need to up the ante on people skills and organisation
